subject: p13964474
History: Evaluation of the patient with esophageal-pleural fistula and right necrotizing pneumonia, now with esophageal stent replacement, PEG replacement and continue secretions.
Findings: AP radiograph of the chest was compared to. The ET tube tip is 7 cm above the carina. The esophageal stent is in place, unchanged since the prior study. The right internal jugular line tip is at the level of superior SVC. There is redemonstration of pneumoperitoneum, at least mild-to-moderate, grossly unchanged since the prior study. Extensive parenchymal consolidations are unchanged as well, predominantly involving the right mid and lower lung and then the left mid lobe.
